deduct.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to take away an amount or part from a total
deduct.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The payments will be deducted from your salary.
deduct.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to take away an amount from a total
deduct.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Brazil has about 48 million bags of coffee available for sale; from this, deduct about eight million bags for domestic use.
deduct.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to take away an amount from an employee’s pay for a particular purpose before they receive it
deduct.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: We deduct the pension contributions from employees’ paychecks.
deduct.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to take away particular costs from the amount you have earned before you calculate how much tax you will have to pay on what you have earned
deduct.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: Self-employed people can deduct 100% of health-insurance costs against income.
